19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Shame, shamefacedness, shameful deeds. From aischunomai; shame or disgrace.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
19.str2: (a) I think, (b) I think, judge, (c) I direct the mind to, seek for, (d) I observe, (e) I care for.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

20.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A state, commonwealth. From politeuomai; a community, i.e. citizenship.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
20.str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

20.str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular

21.str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Working, action, productive work, activity; in the NT, confined to superhuman activity. From energes; efficiency.

21.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
21.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: Her own, his own, their own, themselves, they. Contracted for heautou; self.

21.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: From meta and a derivative of schema; to transfigure or disguise; figuratively, to apply.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
21.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Abasement (in spirit), low condition (in circumstances). From tapeinoo; depression.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Similar, conformed to. From sun and morphe; jointly formed, i.e. similar.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
